intro: Centaurea ovina subsp. caprina, commonly known as goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces bright yellow to orange flowers with distinctive white bracts. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
